title: Which king had the longest reign over the Kingdom of Israel? - Quora

response.answer_text: File:Kings of Judah and Israel.jpg Take a look at all the kings and their reigns. You asked specifically regarding Israel - Not sure if you are aware that the kingdom was split most of the time. Initially Shaul became king and was backed by Shmuel, but when he failed to fight Amalek, Shmuel annointed David and was backed by Yehuda - Israel still followed Shaul, and even David maintained his respect for him and his title. When Shaul and his sons were killed, Israel came to back David and the kingdoms were united by the act of the elders of Israel annointing David to rule over Israel. As you can see in the table, 40 years united and 41 Yehuda under Asa.

Manasseh who was the fourteenth king of the kingdom of Judah.He was the oldest of the sons of Hezekiah and his wife Hephzibah( Zephaniah 1:1) He became King at the age of 12 and ruled for 55 year's.(2 Kings 21:1; 2 Chronicles 33:1.
